name: VERIFICATION ACTIVITY: Service plans and GPR Markouts

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Services sufficiently deep to avoid damage.
TYPE: Mandatory HOLD POINT Engineer Signoff Required
2 - Milling / Cut to Waste (350mm at Weymouth and 400mm at Roscommon)
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Dip from stringline or survey as- built
TYPE: Mandatory HOLD POINT Engineer Signoff Required
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY: No unacceptable subgrade materials after excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Free of detritius and loose material. Subgrade Treatment may Required
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY: Testing, Scala Penetrometer Testing, Shear Vane testing, and Proof rolling
FREQUENCY: At 10m intervals staggered in each wheel path
○ Subgrade CBR > 3%, Scala < 50mm per blow, shear vane >= 60kPa and no visual movement under static roller.
TYPE: Mandatory HOLD POINT Designer Signoff Required
RECORDS: Testing results, QA and video of proof rolling.
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY: Testing, Scala Penetrometer Testing, Shear Vane testing, and Proof rolling
FREQUENCY: At 10m intervals staggered in each wheel path
○ Subgrade CBR 2 - 3%, Scala 50 - 100mm per blow, shear vane 40 - 60kPa and visual movement under static roller.
– No Undercut required at Weymouth East and Geotextile to remain at bottom of concrete subbase.
– 150mm undercut required at Roscommon Road and geotextile placed before backfilling with granular
TYPE: Mandatory HOLD POINT Designer Signoff Required
RECORDS: Testing results, QA and video of proof rolling.
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY: Testing, Scala Penetrometer Testing, Shear Vane testing, and Proof rolling
FREQUENCY: At 10m intervals staggered in each wheel path
○ Subgrade CBR 1 - 2%, Scala >= 100mm per blow, shear vane 20 - 40kPa and visual movement under static roller.
– 200mm Undercut required at Weymouth East and geotextile placed before backfilling with granular.
– 250mm undercut required and geotextile placed before backfilling with granular

RECORDS: Testing results, QA and video of proof rolling.

○ No trafficking of the excavated subgrade

TYPE: In process Inspection and Contractor Records

METHODS OR REFERENCE: Dip from string line

TYPE: Mandatory HOLD POINT Designer Signoff Required
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Strength = 20MPa Slump = 130mm pump mix
○ Pump mix being used hence cannot specify slump. Shape of the concrete to be closely monitored due to fluidity nature of pump mix on graded surface
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Dip from stringline or survey as- built to top of subbase (Surveyor to provide set-out information prior to concrete pour)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rough surface verified over 100% of surface area

TYPE: Mandatory HOLD POINT Designer Signoff Required
Emulsion – Tack and Blind (Concrete and AC layer)
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY: CAT60 cationic emulsion or approved alternative
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Hand spray tack coat emulsion
Structural Asphalt (AC20 – 160mm in two lifts 80mm each)
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Forecast and thermometer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No fog, rain or wet surface. Base temp ≥ 7o C
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY: Ensure previous layer is broomed clean
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Free of detritius and loose material
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Grading, binder content, max density, temp
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Visual inspection by the Engineer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Uniform texture, no roller marks, no bleeding, cracking or shoving, no crushing of the aggregate.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The new pavement shall have an average dynamic roughness, when measured over a length of 100m, of less than 60 NAASRA counts/km for any three consecutive results and no individual value greater than 70
METHODS OR REFERENCE: NZTA M/10 spec
FREQUENCY: At joints and any other areas of concern
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Irregularities < 5mm under straight edge
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Contract Spec / M10 Spec
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Asphalt not to be paved when foggy or raining, or placed on a wet surface or when temperature is below the base temperature limitations of 120 Degree

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Swept clean; all necessary measures to prevent ponding prior to any surfacing
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Grading, binder content, max density, temp

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 40 mm minimum and 45 mm maximum compacted depth
